general_advisory: As dry weather condition is prevailed in the upcoming week, farmers are advised to make arrangements for providing irrigation to different standing crops. There is a chance of increase in various disease infestation in both field as well as vegetable crops due to prevailing low night temperature and high humidity so regular monitoring against these diseases should be advised. Looking to the prevailing night temperature condition, farmers are advised to take proper care of their crops as well as animals accordingly to protect them from cold. Deworming and vaccination should be advised in animals to boost immunity and protect them from any harmful diseases.

advisory: If rice is at maturity stage, stop irrigation in the field before harvesting.
Harvest the plants when 80-85% of the grains have matured and the plant looks pale yellow in color.
After harvesting rice, dry in the field for 2-3 days and thereafter threshing should be done. Rice should be stored at a moisture level of 12%.

Due to low night temperature and high humidity, there may be a chance of high incidence of False Smut and Neck/Panicle blast in late maturing rice varieties, so its regular monitoring should be advised.
To control bollworm complex in cotton crop, farmers are advised to spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG or Profenophos 50% EC under clear weather.
Harvesting of matured boll should be advised.
One thinning operation should be advised to maintain optimum plant population in mustard in case of dense planting.
Hoeing and weeding operation is advised in case of a crop 15 to 20 days old.

To control Fruit and shoot borer in Okra, spraying of Neem-based pesticide should be advised at initial stages. In severe cases, alternate spray of Spinosad and Emamectin benzoate at 15 days interval should be advised.
Harvesting of mature crop should be advised.
Nursery bed should be prepared with a length of 3m, 1m breadth, and 15-20 cm height.
Before sowing, application of well-decomposed FYM and chlorpyriphos dust to each nursery bed should be advised.
Regular monitoring against the attack of Diamond back moth in cauliflower should be advised, and if possible, farmers should use pheromone trap in the field for this purpose.
